Hi,

Thank you Andrew for the reply.
I have already ignored the robot polic=
y in cxml. I have attached the cxml
with this. But still I could not re-cre=
ate these sites. But in archive.org,
these sites can be seen clearly.
In wa=
yback-1.6, is it looking into old template files, css and apply them
to the=
 newer files automatically?

Regards

On Wed, Dec 11, 2013 at 2:17 PM, Jack=
son, Andrew <andrew.jackson@...>wrote:

>
>
> For 1) I notice that there =
is a restrictive robots.txt that might be
> kicking in (even though it is i=
n the wrong place
> http://www.mrt.ac.lk/web/robots.txt). You could check t=
he crawl log for
> clues, e.g. -9998 Robots.txt rules precluded fetch. (
> =
https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Status+Codes).
>
>
>
> Or=
, the problems could all be to do with playback. As far as 2) goes,
> we=92=
ve observed problems with some recent versions of Wayback breaking
> playba=
ck of deduplicated archives, and had to step back to v. 1.6.x to get
> thin=
gs working (IIRC).
>
>
>
> Hope that helps,
>
>
>
> Andy Jackson

chine. I

>

reatable properly. Ex:

cation rduction processor. Therefore the sites which
> are re-creatable fir=
st day cannot be recreate 2nd day.

re with. Can you please send me a solution
> to this.
>

nt for me. Please help.
>

<p>Hi<u></u><u></u></p><p><u></u>=A0<u></u></p><p>I'm using=

<p>After crawling, I tried to re-create these pag=

k/web/</a><u></u><u></u></p>

or. Therefore the sites which are re-creatable first day cannot be recreate=
 2nd day.<u></u><u></u></p><p><u></u>=A0<u></u></p><p>I have attached the c=

></p>
